reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simple and unpretentious Culebra Beach Villas was absolutely a great beach cottage rental. It is on the most perfect beach, and each studio comes with a large verandah, hammock and grill. They also provide with you with all the kitchen utensils.
reviews.title: absolutely perfect beach vacation

likes.disliked: — lighting in the rooms, and cleanliness of the linens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our studio room was pretty basic with a view of a gorgeous green hill. Most cottages do not have a beach view, unless you are in the wooden beach front building. However these rooms are really packed together and not as private. The people in the office were very nice and allowed us to check in a little early. On the 2nd day our home rigged shower broke, but they came by right away and fixed it.
reviews.title: One of the best places to vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is definitely not a boutique hotel or resort. But super charming.
reviews.title: Loved every minute!

reviews.text: Btw the residents of the place include a dozen cats and roosters.
reviews.title: nice place

likes.liked: — clean place, confortable and close of the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancee and I went to Culebra Beach Villas for a week during the month of October. We flew from San Juan Puerto Rico to Isla Culebra and minutes after arriving we fell in love with the people and the Island. We met some of the most friendliest people as soon as we arrived to the small airport. It turns out we happened to be on the same flight with someone from management who then proceeded to offer us a ride to the villas saving us time and confusion. When we arrived to the villas we were quickly checked in and invited to a bbq with management and other locals from the island. Soon after that, they made every attempt to make us feel comfortable and have a wonderful experience during our stay. They gave us tips on what to do and see, and even invited us to their houses for drinks. The villa we stayed in had everything we needed to make ourselves at home and was clean. We found utensils, pots, microwave, refrigerator, etc, etc. We were able to cook our own romantic dinners in one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. We have traveled to many places but we have never before had the service, friendliness, and detail we had during our stay in Culebra Beach Villas. Also since we arrived during slow season we practically had Flaminco Beach to ourselves! The only thing this place lacks is a closer grocery store since it takes about 10-15 minutes to the closest one. I would recommend taking energy bars or some sort of snack to have around until you can make it to the store especially if you have children. And believe me, if you have children this is the place to stay! I cannot wait to go back and maybe take my niece since the beach is perfect for children as well. If you are looking to relax in a down to earth place with wonderful people this is the place. I would not recommend this place for anyone expecting to stay in expensive resorts with room service.
reviews.title: Beautiful but isolated

likes.disliked: — condition of animals on the property

reviews.text: Our family of 5 stayed in 3-bdrm unit #4-A for 4 nights in March. My expectations were low after reading the reviews. But we had a fantastic stay and would probably return. The location right on Playa Flamenca is unsurpassed - pristine and private. Even on the weekends, it wasn't that crowded (I know that may be different in summer when Puerto Ricans vacation there).
reviews.title: Location, location, locagion
Sleeping with bedbugs..
reviews.text: Our unit was on the 3rd floor - lots of stairs, but that wasn't a problem for us. The balcony overlooked the beach - the views were fantastic. The unit was spartan, but extremely clean. The beds were OK, linens were basic. The kitchen was stocked with all the basic essentials for cooking, but nothing else was supplied except sponge and soap (e.g., no paper towels). We used the BBQs downstairs. Tony, the property manager, was friendly and helpful. He gave us his restaurant recommendations and happily fixed a A/C unit in one of our bedrooms. Ice and water are available for sale from the office. A car is a necessity here, in my opinion, for grocery shopping and restaurant meals in town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to be on one of the most spectacular beaches in the Caribbean, you like privacy and peace and you don't mind self-catering, Culebra Beach Villas is for you. If you expect ANY amenities, don't consider it.
reviews.title: Rats in our bedroom

likes.disliked: — rats and general lack of cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location but were eaten alive by the bedbugs in shack number 11. Also, the chickens will wake you up in the middle of the night and you won't get much sleep. They charge you for ice, the building 'manager' is not very friendly, never staying here again.
reviews.title: Must stay!

likes.disliked: — Mosquitoes, but hey, what do you expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place was below average anyway, but the rats that crawled in beneath the kitchen sink and left poop all over the kitchen counter were too much. And NO, we did not have any food anywhere in the room. The rats kept us up all night and when we talked to the managers in the morning they said they would take care of it and stuffed the hole underneath with some foam. That lasted until 5 a..m. and then the rats broke through again. Disgusting. Management provided NO apology or any kind of refund. Avoid this place.
reviews.title: Memorable !!

reviews.text: My husband and our 4 year old daughter stayed in Unit 3A at CBV from 2/20-2/22. The location is fabulous! It was so nice hearing the ocean from your bedroom, that was def worth the price! But the villa itself, for the price, should of been better. Half of our shutters did not open, therefore, we could not get any type of breeze through them. Some of the windows were missing screens so we could not open them at all. I went to open a cabinet in the kitchen and the handle fell off. The villa def needed some improvements but it did not ruin our vacation. We rented a jeep thru carlos jeep for the two days. toured the island. very nice. flamenco beach is out of this world and the location was awesome but i dont know if the actual villa was worth the money!
reviews.title: The Beach was A+ but room was B-
Living in a cave.
reviews.text: In 22 years of visiting 24 islands in the Caribbean I have experienced only two beaches that I like better than Flamenco. Classic, beautiful, long, wide, soft white sand.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room, however, was dreadful. No window in the bedroom. It was like going into a cave. When I asked the next morning to be moved, I was told that all the rooms were taken. That was not true. There were very few people on the property. Even on the weekend, it didn't look like even half the units were being used. I walked around at night and counted those with lights.
reviews.title: Very near beach, but villa condition leave much to be desired at price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in 1-C. The couple next to me was in 1-E. (I don't know what happened to 1-D. Maybe that's where Harry Potter and his friends stay!) 1-E was even worse than mine, narrower, and only one window in the kitchen and none in the bedroom.
reviews.title: Rustic, Romantic and Right on the Beach!
Amazing Culebra!!
reviews.text: They had made their reservation in November. I had made mine October 8. Why the resort assigned such horrible rooms to early renters and why they refused to move us to something better is a mystery.
I have mixed feelings about Culebra beach villas rental.
reviews.title: Best place to enjoy the beautiful beach- Flamenco

reviews.text: The villas had all I needed- from comfortable bed to great equipment kitchen and above all the location which was perfect as I really wanted to wake up everyday in one of the most amazing and famous beaches- Flamenco. I also loved the hammock/sling which was quite good when I wanted to rest outside. There's also barbeque place in each villa.
reviews.title: Very Expensive with Problems

likes.disliked: — The flying roaches while we sleep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the other hand, you must take in mind that flamenco beach is little bit isolated in Culebra.
reviews.title: Amazing beach, decent place to stay

reviews.text: I came in Culebra in off season so I didn't expect to see much of tourists, but to be honest I was little bit shock to find out that I was the only one there on my first day of arrival. Moreover, when I got to the beach rental the office was empty and no one actually checked in me. The owner left me a note with the room number also saying the key was inside the room (villa 15).
reviews.title: amazing views

reviews.text: After settling, I realized that I need to go back to the main area of the island for some groceries but unfortunately my cellular didn't have sign so when I tried to call from the public phone near the office I found out that there was no line there too.
reviews.title: Ultimate relaxation on the most beautiful beach
